item.title: Training a Deep Learning Model for Cell Counting in 17 Lines of Code with 17 Images
item.description: üï∂Ô∏è Motivation Numerous biology and medical procedures involve counting cells from images taken with microscope. Counting cells reveals the concentration of bacteria and viruses and gives vital information on the progress of a disease. To accomplish the counting, researchers painstakingly count the cells by hand with the assistance of a device called hemocytometer. This process is repetitive, tedious, and prone to errors. What if we could automate the counting by using an intelligent deep learning algorithm instead?
